title: Marvelous Grace
lyrics_with_chords:
[G]Marvelous grace of our [C]loving [G]Lord,
Grace that [G]exceeds our [C]sin and our [G]guilt!
Yonder on [C]Calvary's [G]mount out-[D]poured–
There where the [G]blood of the [D]Lamb was [G]spilt.

[G]Grace, [G]grace, [C]God's [G]grace,
Grace that will [G]pardon and [C]cleanse with[G]in;
Grace, [G]grace, [C]God's [G]grace,
Grace that is [G]greater than [D]all our [G]sin!

[G]Sin and despair, like the [C]sea-[G]waves cold,
Threaten the [G]soul with [C]infinite [G]loss;
Grace that is [C]greater– [G]yes, grace un-[D]told–
Points to the [G]Refuge, the [D]mighty [G]Cross.

[G]Marvelous, infinite, [C]match-[G]less [C]grace,
Freely be[C]stowed on [G]all who be[D]lieve!
All who are [G]longing to [D]see His [G]face,
Will you this [G]moment His [D]grace re[G]ceive?
lyrics_without_chords:
Marvelous grace of our loving Lord,
Grace that exceeds our sin and our guilt!
Yonder on Calvary's mount out-poured–
There where the blood of the Lamb was spilt.

Grace, grace, God's grace,
Grace that will pardon and cleanse within;
Grace, grace, God's grace,
Grace that is greater than all our sin!

Sin and despair, like the sea-waves cold,
Threaten the soul with infinite loss;
Grace that is greater– yes, grace untold–
Points to the Refuge, the mighty Cross.

Marvelous, infinite, matchless grace,
Freely bestowed on all who believe!
All who are longing to see His face,
Will you this moment His grace receive?

title: Leaning on the Everlasting Arms
lyrics_with_chords:
[G]What a fellowship, what a [C]joy [G]divine,
leaning [G]on the [C]everlasting [G]arms;
what a [C]blessedness, what a [G]peace [D]is [G]mine,
leaning [G]on the [D]everlasting [G]arms.

[G]Leaning, [G]leaning,
[C]safe and secure from all [G]alarms;
[G]leaning, [G]leaning,
[C]leaning on the everlasting [D]arms.

2 [G]O how sweet to walk in this [C]pilgrim [G]way,
leaning [G]on the [C]everlasting [G]arms;
O how [C]bright the path grows from [G]day to [D]day,
leaning [G]on the [D]everlasting [G]arms.

3 [G]What have I to [C]dread, what have I to [G]fear,
leaning [G]on the [C]everlasting [G]arms?
I have [C]blessed peace with my [G]Lord so [D]near,
leaning [G]on the [D]everlasting [G]arms.
lyrics_without_chords:
1 What a fellowship, what a joy divine,
leaning on the everlasting arms;
what a blessedness, what a peace is mine,
leaning on the everlasting arms.

Leaning, leaning,
safe and secure from all alarms;
leaning, leaning,
leaning on the everlasting arms.

2 O how sweet to walk in this pilgrim way,
leaning on the everlasting arms;
O how bright the path grows from day to day,
leaning on the everlasting arms.

3 What have I to dread, what have I to fear,
leaning on the everlasting arms?
I have blessed peace with my Lord so near,
leaning on the everlasting arms.

title: What a Friend We Have in Jesus
lyrics_with_chords:
[C]What a friend [F]We have in [C]Jesus,
All our [C]sins and [G]griefs to [C]bear;
What a [F]privilege to [C]carry
Everything to [G]God in [C]prayer.

[C]Oh what peace
We often [F]forfeit,
[C]Oh what [G]needless [C]pain we [G]bear;
All because we do not [F]carry
Everything to [G]God in [C]prayer.

2 [C]Have we trials and [F]temptations?
[C]Is there [C]trouble [G]any-[C]where?
[C]We should [F]never be [C]discouraged,
Take it to the [G]Lord in [C]prayer.

[C]Can we find a [F]friend so [C]faithful,
Who will [C]all our [G]sorrows [C]share?
[C]Jesus [F]knows our every [C]weakness,
Take it to the [G]Lord in [C]prayer.

3 [C]Are we weak and [F]heavy-[C]laden,
[C]Cumbered [C]with a [G]load of [C]care?
[C]Precious [F]Savior, still our [C]refuge,
Take it to the [G]Lord in [C]prayer.

[C]Do thy friends de-[F]spise, forsake [C]thee?
[C]Take it [C]to the [G]Lord in [C]prayer!
[C]In his [F]arms he'll take and [C]shield [F]thee,
Thou wilt [C]find a solace [G]there.

[C]Blessed [F]Savior, [C]thou hast [G]promised,
[C]Thou wilt [C]hear us [G]when we [C]call;
[C]Thou art [F]willing, [C]thou art [G]able,
[C]To re-[G]lieve us [C]after [G]all.

3 [C]Let us [F]pray, O [C]Lord, [G]revive [C]us,
[C]All our [C]help, from [G]thee [C]we [F]claim;
[C]At thy [G]word, O [C]Lord, [F]re- [C]vive [F]us,
[C]Thou alone hast [G]power to [C]save.
lyrics_without_chords:
Verse 1
What a friend
We have in Jesus
All our sins and griefs to bear
What a privilege to carry
Everything to God in prayer

Pre Chorus
Oh what peace
We often forfeit
Oh what needless pain we bear
All because we do not carry
Everything to God in prayer

Verse 2
Have we trials and temptations
Is there trouble anywhere
Jesus Savior is our refuge
Take it to the Lord in prayer

Pre Chorus
Are we weak and heavy laden
Cumbered with a load of care
Jesus knows our every weakness
Take it to the Lord in prayer

Chorus
Oh what a friend
Oh what a friend
In Jesus

Verse 3
Blessed Savior
You have promised
All our burdens
You will bear May we ever
Lord be bringing all
To you in earnest prayer

Pre Chorus
Soon in glory bright unclouded
Face to face will be our prayer
Joyful praise and
Endless worship
Will be our sweet portion there

Chorus
Oh what a friend
Oh what a friend
In Jesus
